meanings.definition: Work too hard or too long.
meanings.sent1: She was overlaboring on her homework until late at night.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overlabor when he is passionate about a project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overlaboring to gather all the acorns before winter.
meanings.sent4: The engine was overlaboring as it struggled to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The ants were overlaboring to build their intricate underground tunnels.

meanings.sent1: After overlaboring in the garden all day, she was exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The workers were overlaboring under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overlaboring to catch the elusive laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine was overlaboring, emitting loud noises.
meanings.sent5: The students were overlaboring on their group project to meet the deadline.

meanings.sent1: He was overlaboring to impress his boss with his dedication.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overlabor during intense workout sessions.
meanings.sent3: The dog was overlaboring to fetch the ball thrown far away.
meanings.sent4: The tired athlete was overlaboring to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The chef was overlaboring in the kitchen to prepare the perfect dish.
